Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hello Markus,

There is something that
https://sbforge.org/display/NAS/Inte=
grating+Umbra+And+Heritrix+3 neglects
to mention that might explain the pro=
blem you're seeing. AMPQUrlReceiver
needs to be configured with a "queueNam=
e" that matches the clientId set on
AMQPPublishProcessor.

Here is an examp=
le of the relevant configuration from an archive-it crawl
job. Our shouldPr=
ocessRule sends only seeds to umbra. There are reasons for
the particular w=
ay it works which I can explain if anyone is wondering. :)
But the importan=
t thing to be aware of is that the shouldProcessRule can be
used to limit t=
he umbra treatment to the urls of your choice.

        <bean id=3D"amqpUrl=
Receiver"
class=3D"org.archive.crawler.frontier.AMQPUrlReceiver">
         =
       <property name=3D"queueName"
value=3D"archiveit.prod.9876-2015070423=
2858960"/>
                <property name=3D"amqpUri" value=3D"amqp://guest=
:guest@localhost
:5672/%2f"/>
        </bean>

        <bean id=3D"amqpPubl=
ishProcessor"
class=3D"org.archive.modules.AMQPPublishProcessor">
         =
       <property name=3D"amqpUri" value=3D"amqp://guest:guest@localhost
:56=
72/%2f"/>
                <property name=3D"clientId"
value=3D"archiveit.pr=
od.9876-20150704232858960"/>
                <property name=3D"shouldProces=
sRule">
                        <bean
class=3D"org.archive.modules.decideru=
les.ExpressionDecideRule">
                                <property name=
=3D"decision" value=3D"REJECT"/>
                                <property =
name=3D"groovyExpression"
value=3D"!(curi.via =3D=3D null && (curi.=
hasBeenLinkExtracted() ||
(curi.getFetchStatus() >=3D 300 && cur=
i.getFetchStatus() <
400)))"/>
                        </bean>
         =
       </property>
        </bean>

If the problem persists, please send th=
e full stack trace.

Noah


On Mon, Jul 6, 2015 at 3:27 AM, 'Markus.Mirsber=
ger' markus.mirsberger@...
[archive-crawler] <archive-crawler@yahoogroup=
s.com> wrote:

>
>
> Hi,
>
> I am trying to crawl websites through Umbra / =
RabbitMQ to get more URLs
> generated by JS.
> I set up everything as it is=
 described here:
> https://sbforge.org/display/NAS/Integrating+Umbra+And+He=
ritrix+3
>
> I can see in my crawl logs that the URLs are beeing sent to Um=
bra/RabbitMQ
> because of the Status *sentToAMQP*
> I think this means that=
 so far my Requests are successfully sent .....I
> can see the requests in =
the RabbitMQ Webadmin as well.
>
> The problem is that I can not see anythi=
ng comming back from
> Umbra/RabbitMQ ..... the documentation says that I s=
hould see URLs with the
> status* received* *FromAMQP*. This doesnt happen =
but instead I get this
> in my job logs:
>
> *SEVERE problem starting AMQP =
consumer (will try again after 30 seconds)
> (in thread 'AMQPUrlReceiver-st=
arter-restarter')*
>
> My logfile from rabbitmq says this:
>
> =3DINFO REPO=
RT=3D=3D=3D=3D 6-Jul-2015::12:24:41 =3D=3D=3D
> accepting AMQP connection <=
0.15717.1733> (127.0.0.1:45721 ->
> 127.0.0.1:5672)
>
> =3DINFO REPORT=3D=
=3D=3D=3D 6-Jul-2015::12:24:45 =3D=3D=3D
> accepting AMQP connection <0.157=
62.1733> (127.0.0.1:45724 ->
> 127.0.0.1:5672)
>
> =3DINFO REPORT=3D=3D=3D=
=3D 6-Jul-2015::12:25:21 =3D=3D=3D
> closing AMQP connection <0.15762.1733>=
 (127.0.0.1:45724 -> 127.0.0.1:5672)
>
> =3DINFO REPORT=3D=3D=3D=3D 6-Jul-2=
015::12:25:21 =3D=3D=3D
> closing AMQP connection <0.15717.1733> (127.0.0.1=
:45721 -> 127.0.0.1:5672)
>
>
> As you can see rabbitmq is acception 2 conn=
ections from heritrix and when
> I finish the crawl both are closed.
> I th=
ink they are used to send the URLs. After acception the connections
> and s=
ome seconds the "AMQP consumer" problem occours and keeps comming
> every 3=
0 seconds as the AMQPUrlReceiver tries to start a consumer.
>
> Does anyone=
 have an idea what might be the problem? Did I miss anything
> which wasn't=
 described in the howto above?
>
>
> Thanks,
> Markus
>
>
>
>
> 
>

--001a113cd8521fdeeb051a3e0d22

<br><br>





    Hi,<br>
    <br>
=
    I am trying to crawl websites through Umbra / RabbitMQ to get more
    =
URLs generated by JS.<br>
    I set up everything as it is described here: =
<a href=3D"https://sbforge.org/display/NAS/Integrating+Umbra+And+Heritrix+3=
" target=3D"_blank">https://sbforge.org/display/NAS/Integrating+Umbra+And+H=
eritrix+3</a><br>
    <br>
    I can see in my crawl logs that the URLs are=
 beeing sent to
    Umbra/RabbitMQ because of the Status <b>sentToAMQP</b><=
b><span style=3D"color:rgb(34,34,34);font-family:monospace;font-size:small;=
font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;font-weight:normal;letter-spacing:nor=
mal;line-height:4.80000019073486px;text-align:left;text-indent:0px;text-tra=
nsform:none;white-space:pre-wrap;word-spacing:0px;display:inline!important;=
float:none;background-color:rgb(249,249,249)"></span></b><b><span style=3D"=
color:rgb(34,34,34);font-family:monospace;font-size:small;font-style:normal=
;font-variant:normal;font-weight:normal;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:4=
.80000019073486px;text-align:left;text-indent:0px;text-transform:none;white=
-space:pre-wrap;word-spacing:0px;display:inline!important;float:none;backgr=
ound-color:rgb(249,249,249)"></span></b><br>
    I think this means that so=
 far my Requests are successfully sent
    .....I can see the requests in t=
he RabbitMQ Webadmin as well.<br>
    <br>
    The problem is that I can no=
t see anything comming back from
    Umbra/RabbitMQ ..... the documentation=
 says that I should see URLs
    with the status<b> received</b>
    
    <=
b>FromAMQP</b><b><span style=3D"color:rgb(51,51,51);font-family:Arial,sans-=
serif;font-size:14px;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;font-weight:norm=
al;letter-spacing:normal;line-height:20px;text-align:left;text-indent:0px;t=
ext-transform:none;white-space:normal;word-spacing:0px;display:inline!impor=
tant;float:none;background-color:rgb(255,255,255)"></span></b>. This doesnt=
 happen but instead
    I get this in my job logs:<br>
    <br>
    <b>SEVE=
RE problem starting AMQP consumer (will try again after 30
      seconds) (=
in thread 'AMQPUrlReceiver-starter-restarter')</b><br>
    <br>
   =
 My logfile from rabbitmq says this:<br>
    <br>
    
    =3DINFO REPORT=
=3D=3D=3D=3D 6-Jul-2015::12:24:41 =3D=3D=3D<br>
    accepting AMQP connecti=
on <0.15717.1733> (<a href=3D"http://127.0.0.1:45721" target=3D"_blan=
k">127.0.0.1:45721</a>
    -> <a href=3D"http://127.0.0.1:5672" target=
=3D"_blank">127.0.0.1:5672</a>)<br>
    <br>
    =3DINFO REPORT=3D=3D=3D=3D=
 6-Jul-2015::12:24:45 =3D=3D=3D<br>
    accepting AMQP connection <0.157=
62.1733> (<a href=3D"http://127.0.0.1:45724" target=3D"_blank">127.0.0.1=
:45724</a>
    -> <a href=3D"http://127.0.0.1:5672" target=3D"_blank">12=
7.0.0.1:5672</a>)<br>
    <br>
    =3DINFO REPORT=3D=3D=3D=3D 6-Jul-2015::1=
2:25:21 =3D=3D=3D<br>
    closing AMQP connection <0.15762.1733> (<a =
href=3D"http://127.0.0.1:45724" target=3D"_blank">127.0.0.1:45724</a> ->=

    <a href=3D"http://127.0.0.1:5672" target=3D"_blank">127.0.0.1:5672</a>=
)<br>
    <br>
    =3DINFO REPORT=3D=3D=3D=3D 6-Jul-2015::12:25:21 =3D=3D=
=3D<br>
    closing AMQP connection <0.15717.1733> (<a href=3D"http:/=
/127.0.0.1:45721" target=3D"_blank">127.0.0.1:45721</a> ->
    <a href=
=3D"http://127.0.0.1:5672" target=3D"_blank">127.0.0.1:5672</a>)<br>
    <b=
r>
    <br>
    As you can see rabbitmq is acception 2 connections from her=
itrix and
    when I finish the crawl both are closed.<br>
    I think they=
 are used to send the URLs. After acception the
    connections and some se=
conds the "AMQP consumer" problem occours and
    keeps comming e=
very 30 seconds as the AMQPUrlReceiver tries to start
    a consumer.<br>
 =
   <br>
    Does anyone have an idea what might be the problem? Did I miss
=
    anything which wasn't described in the howto above?<br>
    <br>
  =
